images.place: KJ Dim Sum and Seafood, Las Vegas, Nevada

description:
[Jasmine tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jasmine_tea) is green tea scented with jasmine blossoms.

**Characters**

In Mandarin, jasmine tea is 茉莉花茶, where [茉莉花](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8C%89%E8%8E%89%E8%8A%B1) is *jasmine flower* ([茉莉](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8C%89%E8%8E%89) is [jasmine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jasmine) and [花](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8A%B1) is *flower*), and {茶} is [tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tea). But in Cantonese it's more often referred to as [香片](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%A6%99%E7%89%87), where [香](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%A6%99) is *fragrant* (same as the first character in Hong Kong 香港, *fragrant harbor*) and [片](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E7%89%87) is *piece* or in this case specifically *flake* as in flakes of tea, so [香片](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%A6%99%E7%89%87) is *fragrant flakes of tea*.

This is a [jasmine tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jasmine_tea) mixed with honey, served cold.

**Characters**

[茉莉](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8C%89%E8%8E%89) is [jasmine](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jasmine), [蜜](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%9C%9C) is *honey*, and {茶} is [tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tea), so 茉莉蜜茶 is *jasmine honey tea*.

images.place: Dim Sum Cafe, Las Vegas, Nevada

description:
A light sweet herbal tea brewed with chyrsanthemum flower blossoms, [chrysanthmum tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Chrysanthemum_tea) is the standard non-caffeinated tea option in dim sum restaurants.

**Characters**

[菊花](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8F%8A%E8%8A%B1) is *chrysanthemum flower* ([菊](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8F%8A) is *chrysanthemum* and [花](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8A%B1) is *flower*), and {茶} is [tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tea), so [菊花茶](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8F%8A%E8%8A%B1%E8%8C%B6) is *chrysanthemum flower tea*.

[Pu'er tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pu%27er_tea) is a dark, fully fermented tea grown in the Yunnan province of China. It is *post-fermented*, where the leaves age even after drying.

**Trivia**

The Dragonball Z character [Puar](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_Dragon_Ball_characters#Puar) is named after Pu'er tea.

**Characters**

[普洱](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/普洱) is *Pu'er* (the English spelling is patterned after the Mandarin pronunciation), the city in Yunnan associated with the tea. And {茶} is [tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tea)., so [普洱茶](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E6%99%AE%E6%B4%B1%E8%8C%B6) is *Pu'er tea*.

[Pu'er tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Pu%27er_tea) blended with chrysanthemum to add a lighter flavor and fragrance.

**Characters**

[菊](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8F%8A) is *chrysanthemum*, and [普](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E6%99%AE) is the first character for *Pu'er* ([普洱](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/普洱)), so [菊普](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8F%8A%E6%99%AE) is *chrysanthemum Pu'er*.

Or think of it as a mashup of chrysanthemum tea ([菊花茶](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8F%8A%E8%8A%B1%E8%8C%B6)) and Pu'er tea ([普洱茶](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E6%99%AE%E6%B4%B1%E8%8C%B6)), and combine the first characters from the two names.

Black tea scented with [lychee](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lychee) peels, so it's got a fruity taste.

**Characters**

[荔枝](https://en.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E8%8D%94%E6%9E%9D) is *lychee*, and {茶} is [tea](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Tea)., so 荔枝茶 is *lychee tea*.
